title.narrative: UNODC Institutional Transparency and Citizen Participation at municipal levels
UNODC Institutionell transparens och medborgarinflytande på kommunal nivå

description.narrative: Objective 1: Number of Autonomous Municipal Governments have reduced their levels of corruption risks in at least 12 identified areas. Objective 2: Organized civil society, with emphasis on women's organizations, is empowered to exercise its right to social control in the beneficiary municipalities. Objective 3: Culture of transparency and integrity has been promoted in the targeted municipalities. new Objective 4: An official Bolvian data base on species of plants and animals living in Bolivian forests has been produced.

Insatsen syftar till att stärka en kultur av transparens och minska korruptionen i 60 utvalda kommuner genom att stärka den tekniska kompetensen för de kvinnor och män som arbetar i kommunerna vad avser effektiv kommunal förvaltning.

UNODC has applied to Sida for funding of 18 million SEK to carry out the "Institutional Transparency and Citizen Participation at municipal levels" in 60 selected Bolivian municipalities, during the period June 2017 – March 2020.
The idea behind the present proposal is that selected municipalities will start promoting a culture of transparency, while receiving technical assistance to improve the municipal officials' skills in order to deliver more efficient services to their communities. Also, civil society organisations, especially led by women, will also receive technical assistance to enhance their social control capabilities.

sector.narrative: Decentralisation and support to subnational government

tag.narrative: 16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: During 2019, the main advances in the intervention can be summarised as follows: Objective 1: 55 municipalities have concluded their diagnoses to determine their most vulnerable areas of corruption, which are: i) budget planning and execution, ii) tax management, iii) accounting and internal control, iv) municipal procedures and services, v) human resources, vi) procurement, vii) access to municipal information, viii) legislation and follow-up, and ix) promotion of transparency and fight against corruption. In addition 54 municipalities have issued municipal laws or decrees aproving their own municipal policies on transparency and fight against corruption. . Objective 2: In 2019, more that 600 representatives from civil society were trained on accountability, rights to information, social control, transparent transition and procurement. Objective 3: In 2019, 200 teachers (42% of which were women) from 42 municipalities have been trained in the use of the tool box on transparency (prepared by UNODC the year before) and to prmote transparency and integrity so as to incorporate such learning in daily classes. Further, 41 new national youth networks on transparency were created in 26 municipalities. Objective 4: results will be presented in 2020 as this objective was incorporated in late 2019.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
